metadata.titel_preek: What a Difference a Week Makes!

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God's resilient purpose (the Angel) protects the vulnerable promise (Jesus) from the destructive powers of the world (Herod) to ensure the possibility of a new beginning.

subject.identificatie: The Angel of the Lord (as the 'overplus of God’s power')
tekstueel_bewijs: The angel takes the initiative in keeping the vulnerable baby safe
The angel is the wild card in the deck of God’s history
The angel is an agent to bring the baby to the land of ministry

object.identificatie: The survival and homecoming of the 'Newness' (Jesus/The Promise)
tekstueel_bewijs: the world is open, and we are available for change
God’s powerful resolve is at work
God’s overplus of power and love
carries the dreams of the kingdom and the hopes of humanity
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer identifies as a vulnerable Receiver/Observer of the conflict.

helper.identificatie: The Angel (acting as the Subject's extension) and Old Testament memories (Exodus)
tekstueel_bewijs: the angel had long ago led Moses out of danger
old memories of angels who are bodyguards
helper.rol_van_god: God is the Subject acting through the Angel.

tekstueel_bewijs: world organized in unjust, greedy, and brutal ways
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: Herod is not just a historical figure but an embodiment of 'resistance to the movement of God' and 'brutalizing power unleashed'.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The hearer's decision to 'bet their life' on the vulnerable Jesus rather than the power of Herod.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Hearer
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The primary program (God saving Jesus) creates the 'opening' that makes the secondary program (our change) possible.

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.zender_naar_ontvanger: God's Resolve → The Promise of Newness → Humanity
actantieel_schema_visualisatie.helper_subject_tegenstander: Scriptural Memory → The Angel (God's Power) ← Herod/Evil
actantieel_schema_visualisatie.subject_naar_object: God's Power → Protection of the Vulnerable Christ

voorbeelden_god_subject: God’s powerful resolve is at work
The event of Christmas is an assertion about God’s power
voorbeelden_mens_subject: we return to our ordinary weariness
we are so sure and see so well

voorbeelden: where we must live and decide
we might not know his statement is ironic
power that the categories of Herod can never discern

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on the 'Overplus of Power' (Pouvoir) belonging to God, which overcomes the 'Power' of Herod, thereby enabling the hearer's 'Willingness' (Vouloir).

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From ~S1 (Romantic Christmas) to S2 (Herod's rage) to ~S2 (The vulnerable baby) and finally to S1 (The Angel's/God's resilient power).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by the 'Wild Card' (The Angel) who ensures that ~S2 (Weakness) is actually the site of S1 (Power).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Very high; the 'slaughter of the innocents' is used to prevent a 'romantic' escape.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is profoundly theocentric. While it calls for a 'decision,' that decision is framed as a response to an objective 'overplus of power' that has already changed the narrative landscape.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: pick a winner... bet your life

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: The angel takes the initiative in keeping the vulnerable baby safe
ruthless killer... socio-political, military, economic form [of evil]

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Biblical characters are analyzed for their functional roles in God's drama, not as moral templates for the hearer to imitate.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The characters (Herod, Mary, Joseph) are acted upon by the 'Difference a week makes' (God's intervention).

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and awe; moving from the burden of 'control' to the freedom of 'God's resolve'.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic preservation: God protects the promise when humans are passive or threatened.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the 'innocence' of Christmas to the 'brutality' of the Epiphany season is masterfully handled through the actantial shift of the Angel.
spanning_punten: The tension between the 'passive baby' and the 'driving force of the story'.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: God’s power in the world against the power of evil... Herod is gone, vanished from history.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The 'Angel' functions as a pneumatological surrogate—the 'wild card' that provides the 'Pouvoir' (Power) where humans have none.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin is seen as a 'furious rage' and 'brutalizing power' that requires divine intervention to escape.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully maintains God (via the Angel) as the Subject of the primary narrative program. The hearer is correctly positioned as the beneficiary of a conflict they cannot win on their own.

identificatie_herstel.problematische_identificatie: The 'bet your life' metaphor briefly shifts the hearer into a 'Subject' role of their own salvation.
identificatie_herstel.voorgestelde_identificatie: Reinforce the hearer as the 'sheep' being carried by the 'Angel of His presence'.
identificatie_herstel.strategie: Soften the gambling metaphor to emphasize 'resting' in the victory already won.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Slightly more Savoir (Knowledge) regarding how the 'vulnerable power' specifically manifests in the hearer's daily life.
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Provide one concrete example of the 'Angel's intervention' in a modern context.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: The current structure (Soteriology → Ethics/Change) is correct.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This is a masterful example of theocentric preaching that refuses to let the hearer become the hero of the story, even while demanding a response.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: A rhetorical analysis would focus on the 'week' metaphor; Greimas shows that the 'Angel' is the structural engine of the grace-message.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains Matthew's use of Hosea; semiotics explains how the 'Angel' functions as the 'Pouvoir-faire' of God.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the 'vulnerability' of Jesus is a modal state (~Pouvoir) that necessitates the 'Angel' as a secondary Subject to complete the narrative program.

appendices.notities: The sermon avoids the 'Exemplarism' trap by treating Herod and the Angel as cosmic forces rather than just moral examples.
